articles.title: Russian Dance Company Performs in Wonsan
articles.content:
Russian Dance Company Performs in Wonsan
 Pyongyang, June 21 (KCNA) -- Performances of the Russian State Academic Igor Moiseyev Dance Company are going on at the Kalma Theatre in Wonsan City, Kangwon Province, since June 18.
					 Russian dancers put on the stage colorful pieces representing national emotion and customs of peoples of Russia and other countries.
					
					 The performers vividly depicted patriotism and life of the Russian army and people in Russian dance "Summer," "Yablochko" from fleet dance suite and other pieces.
					
					 Through Greek dance suite "Sirtaki," Argentinean cowboy dance "Gaucho" and other numbers the Russian dancers showed folk dance movement of other countries with high artistic skill and also presented Korean folk dance "Trio Dance."
					
					 Among the audience were officials concerned and creators, artistes, journalists and editors in the field of the literature and arts and media and university teachers and students in Wonsan.

articles.title: S. Korean Dictatorial Regime's Unjust Decisions Protested
articles.content:
S. Korean Dictatorial Regime's Unjust Decisions Protested
Pyongyang, June 21 (KCNA) -- Victims of unjust decisions by the south Korean military fascist dictatorial regime in the past applied for retrials to the puppet Seoul Central District Court on June 16.
					 In this regard, the Bar Association for Democratic Society called a press conference in Seoul.
					
					 The director of the Unification Study Center and victims and members of bereaved families made speeches at the press conference. 
					
					 The speakers disclosed the fact that a lot of people were arrested, thrown behind bars and executed on the charge of violation of the "emergency measure" for the mere reason that they took the lead in the struggle against the undemocratic "Yushin constitution" and that they were taken to the Central Intelligence Agency on the unjust charge of "participation in illegal demonstration" and "spreading of rumors" and suffered all kinds of tortures and threats.
					
					 Noting that the horrible sufferings inflicted upon the victims and bereaved families are beyond description, they denounced the heinous human rights abuses committed by the "Yushin" dictatorship force.
					
					 They inquired how the "Yushin constitution" could be law, holding that they are innocent.
					
					 They urged the judicial authorities to correct the unjust decisions resulted from the "Yushin constitution" and "emergency measure" and restore the honor of the victims.

articles.title: Opening up New Era of Reunification, Peace and Prosperity Called for
articles.content:
Opening up New Era of Reunification, Peace and Prosperity Called for
 Pyongyang, June 21 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee of the Students Committee of the Youth and Students Solidarity for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration was inaugurated with due ceremony in Seoul on June 14.
					 A declaration read out at the ceremony recalled that after the publication of the June 15 joint declaration all fellow countrymen vigorously struggled to open the new era of independent reunification, peace and prosperity under the banner of "By our nation itself."
					
					 The achievements in the movement for inter-Korean reconciliation, cooperation and reunification were nullified overnight after the Lee Myung Bak regime emerged, exposing the Korean Peninsula to the danger of war and tension, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 The U.S. is putting forward the Lee regime as a shock brigade in executing its strategy for domination of Korea, while talking about "dialogue" and "reconciliation". However, it is intensifying sanctions against the DPRK and war moves to bring it down behind the scene, threatening peace of this land.
					
					 We, youth and students should firmly defend the south-north joint declarations and thoroughly implement them in order to put an end to the Lee Myung Bak fascist regime and open up the new era of independent reunification, peace and prosperity.

articles.title: Movement for Declarations on Situation Unabated in S. Korea
articles.content:
Movement for Declarations on Situation Unabated in S. Korea
Pyongyang, June 21 (KCNA) -- The movement for publishing declarations on the situation of people of different circles for putting an end to the fascist rule by the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors was conducted in south Korea on June 18.
					 More than 16,100 members of the Teachers Union of south Korea made public a declaration on the situation denouncing the Lee Myung Bak group for its highhandedness and dictatorship.
					
					 The declaration said that they turned out in the movement for declaration on the situation to denounce the unpopular policy by the Lee Myung Bak regime forsaken by the people.
					
					 The candlelight resistance that was staged across south Korea last year and the waves of people mourning the former "president" over his recent death represent strong resistance of the people against the dictatorial policy of the authorities going against the times, it noted.
					
					 It deplored the present situation, asking is it possible for the teachers to teach students about democracy under the Lee Myung Bak regime which tramples down even the elementary democratic rights including the freedom of speech, assembly, expression and association.
					
					 The declaration demanded the Lee regime withdraw the unpopular education policy.
					
					 At least 160 postgraduate students of Jeonbug National University released a declaration on the situation.
					
					 Civic and public organizations from different circles in Jeju Island in the declaration on the situation demanded Lee Myung Bak make an apology for the tragedy in Ryongsan, stop suppression under the pretext of public security and withdraw the evil law on labor, etc.

articles.title: Traitor Lee Myung Bak's Servile Tour of U.S. Blasted
articles.content:
Traitor Lee Myung Bak's Servile Tour of U.S. Blasted
 Pyongyang, June 21 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration on June 17 issued a statement to condemn traitor Lee Myung Bak for his servile tour of the U.S. 
					 Referring to the fact that the traitor sat face to face with his U.S. master, held a confab on stifling his fellow countrymen in the DPRK and declared what they called a "joint version statement for south Korea-U.S. alliance" at the White House on June 16, the statement noted that the assertion for "provision of combat force for extended nuclear deterrence" against the DPRK's consolidation of nuclear deterrent for self-defence, a measure taken by it to cope with the U.S. threat of a preemptive nuclear attack on it, would escalate crisis on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 The statement termed his tour sycophantic diplomacy for offering the sovereignty of south Korea to the U.S. as a whole, traitorous diplomacy for begging foreign force to stifle his fellow countrymen and war diplomacy of disturbing peace and aggravating tension on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 Lee Myung Bak will certainly be made to pay a dear price for selling off his nation and harassing peace, the statement warned. 
					
					 The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification also published a statement on June 17 in which it said the above-said version statement aimed to further tighten south Korea-U.S. "alliance" would bring more serious crisis to the Korean Peninsula for its aggressive nature and danger. 
					
					 Civic and public organizations including the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification, the Confederation of Trade Unions and the National Catholic Alliance for Justice of south Korea held the 117th anti-U.S. solidarity rally in Seoul on June 16 to strongly condemn Lee's criminal tour aimed to keep the aggressive south Korea-U.S. "alliance" for an indefinite period.

articles.title: UNSC "Resolution on Sanctions" against DPRK Denounced in Nigeria
articles.content:
UNSC "Resolution on Sanctions" against DPRK Denounced in Nigeria
 Pyongyang, June 21 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea made public a statement on June 14 in denunciation of the United Nations Security Council's "resolution on sanctions" against the DPRK.
					 Recalling that the UNSC adopted the "resolution 1874" in spite of unanimous opposition of the world progressive people, further aggravating the situation of the Korean Peninsula, the statement said:
					
					 Nigerian followers of the Juche idea and peace-loving people fully support the stand of the DPRK and bitterly denounce the UNSC "resolution on sanctions."
					
					 The "resolution on sanctions" against the DPRK goes to prove that the UNSC acts quite contrary to its action principles under the manipulation of the U.S.  Due to such behavior the principle of respect for sovereignty of countries and equality is seriously violated, threatening the very existence of the UN. 
					
					 The statement strongly demanded the UNSC withdraw the "resolution 1874" immediately and thoroughly observe its action principles and stop playing a servant of the U.S. and its followers who force other countries to be obedient to them.
					
					 It called upon the world peace-loving progressive people to turn out as one and fully support the just cause of the Korean people and launch extensive solidarity movement denouncing the above-said "resolution on sanctions" in diverse forms and ways.

articles.title: Korean People's Cause for Independent Reunification Supported
articles.content:
Korean People's Cause for Independent Reunification Supported
Pyongyang, June 21 (KCNA) -- A seminar and a meeting were held in Romania,  a meeting and a film show in Mongolia and Democratic Congo from June 4 to 13 on the occasions of the 9th anniversary of the publication of the June 15 joint declaration and the month of anti-U.S. joint struggle (June 25-July 27 ).
					Displayed in the venues of the events were photos showing the feats of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il and photos introducing the Korean people in their struggle for the country's reunification.
					
					 Speeches were made at the events. 
					
					 Vasile Orleanu, chairman of the Supreme Council of the Socialist Party of Romania, said that Kim Jong Il opened up the bright avenue for the reunification by providing the June 15 joint declaration, the cornerstone of developing the inter-Korean relations and the great programme for the country's reunification, and the October 4 declaration, its practical programme. 
					
					 Daniel Dediu, chairman of the Romanian Workers' Association, said that the inter-Korean relations which had developed on good terms have faced the worst crisis and the situation on the Korean Peninsula is aggravating. He extended support to the Korean people's struggle for the country's reunification and the global independence. 
					
					 Ch. Surenjav, chairman of the Mongolia-Korea Friendship Society, stressed that the Korean people would certainly realize the cause of independent reunification under the leadership of Kim Jong Il despite the separatist forces' evermore undisguised moves against the country's reunification.
					
					 Vele Mukelenge, chairman of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of University of Kinshasa, exposed and denounced traitor Lee Myung Bak for his anti-DPRK and anti-reunification moves. 
					
					 The participants in the film show saw introductory documentary "Arms of the DPRK". 
					
					  Meanwhile, the secretary of the Association of Advocates of African Unity in Libya, and Riyad Chaloub, chairman of the Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, separately issued statements on June 11 and 12 on the occasion of the 9th anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration.

articles.title: Celebrations Held in Different Countries
articles.content:
Celebrations Held in Different Countries
Pyongyang, June 21 (KCNA) -- A seminar was held in Bulgaria, a lecture in South Africa and a briefing in Indonesia on June 9 and 11 on the occasion of the 45th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 Displayed in the venues of the events were works of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, photos showing their feats of the Songun revolutionary leadership and books and photos introducing the DPRK. 
					
					 Lyudmil Kostadinov, chief of the Bulgarian Group for the Study of the Juche Idea who is member of the Central Committee of the Bulgarian Communist Party, said in detail that Kim Jong Il published many works including "Giving Priority to Ideological Work Is Essential for Accomplishing Socialism" and "On Preserving the Juche Character and National Character of the Revolution and Construction" and has consolidated the country's defence capacity as firm as iron wall with his original Songun politics in order to frustrate the imperialists' anti-DPRK and anti-socialist moves. 
					
					 Eddie Kekana, chairman of the Group for the Study of the Progressive Ideas of South Africa and chairman of the Pretoria Branch Democratic Teachers Union of South Africa, stressed that Kim Jong Il's love for the people is reflected in all the wealth and creations of the country and this has become the main source for the single-minded unity. 
					
					 Ristiyanto, general secretary of the National Guidance Council of the Vanguard Party of Indonesia, said that Kim Jong Il's leadership is an ever-victorious leadership, adding that as he has led the WPK and the state, the DPRK turned into a political and military power that any formidable enemy including the U.S. dares not provoke.

articles.title: Centenary of Kim Il Sung's Birth to Be Commemorated in Russia
articles.content:
Centenary of Kim Il Sung's Birth to Be Commemorated in Russia
 Pyongyang, June 21 (KCNA) -- A Russian preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung was formed on June 15.
					 39 figures from all walks of life including Vladimir Tolstikov, chairman of the Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK, Nina Andreyeva, general secretary of the Central Committee of the All-Union Communist Party of Bolsheviks, Sazhi Umalatova, chairperson of the Political Coordinating Council "Patriots of Russia" Party, Dmitri Yazov, former minister of Defence of the Soviet Union, were elected co-chairmen of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee decided to publish works of President Kim Il Sung and hold such colorful political and cultural events as a meeting, remembrance meeting, seminar and photo exhibition and film show.
